page.title: 05TYPICAL DAY IN LIFE OF ADULT
page.content: Mr. B. gets up at 7.10 a.m. and has his breakfast at 8.20 a.m. He opens up his shop at 9 a.m. Mr. B. is a leather merchant. He closes his shop at 12.30 p.m. and has his lunch between then and 2 p.m. when he returns to open his shop. He works until 5 p.m. and has his tea about 5.50 p.m. He usually works in the evening but on two nights a week he goes out on his boat. He keeps his boat at Port Edgar Marina below the Forth Road Bridge. He does not keep it at Dysart Harbour which would be much handier because Dysart is restricted because the entrance to the harbour is silted up. Although he occasionally fishes, his motor boat is used mainly for pleasure. Mr. B. usually goes to bed at 11 p.m. but the lights never go out util 11.40 p.m. as he likes to read for a while.
